result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D Wiest was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: any other sentence

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas D Wiest in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty O'Rourke states DE will waive prelim and plea to Ct 1 of information w/o the repeater.  Atty O'Rourke states agreement.  State agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  State moves to withdraw repeater from Ct 1 of information.  Atty O'Rourke acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and pleads NC.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Parties review VIS.  Atty O'Rourke makes statement on behalf of DE.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE re: voting rights, appeal rights and felony firearm warnings.

Ct 1:  w/o repeater - NC
60 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
To commence on or before 9/11/2015 at 6:00 pm
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided unless one has previously been provided

Defendant Nicholas D Wiest in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Defendant Nicholas D Wiest in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is resolved, however request July date.  Time limits waived.  Court sets for plea, sentencing.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 06-05-2015 11:45 am.
Return date at 06-17-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas D Wiest appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant not yet qualified.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request $500.00 cash bond.  Criminal history or similar charges.  Attorney ORourke request signature bond.  No warrants for failure to appear.  Serving another sentence with huber currently.  Time limits waived.  $3000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 11:45 am.  Return date scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
